page.title: 14SESSAY SPORTS CLUBS
page.content: {Sessay Cricket Club}is a thriving section of the village life with 2 men's XI's (playing in the York Senior League) a junior and a ladies team. The Club has played in the National Village Championship since 1970 and in 1976 played in the final at Lord's. In 1982 we staged the semi-final at Sessay, but lost. The ground is always immaculate and in 1984 was marked second best in the league. The Hall incorporates changing rooms - used by cricketers and{tennis}players. As well as the cricket field and tennis courts there is a{bowling}green which is a hive of activity during the summer months. Summer also sees the schoolchildren playing rounders and cricket and their annual sports day is held here. The various clubs frequently hold their meetings in the Hall.
